name: Divya Prabandhams
description: A collection of 4,000 sacred Tamil hymns composed by the Āḻvārs
longDescription: Revered as the Tamil Veda, it is a compilation of devotional hymns sung by the Āḻvārs extolling Śrīman Nārāyaṇa.

name: Guruparamparā Vaibhavam
description: A glorious chronicle of the revered Ācārya lineage
longDescription: A tribute to the revered Ācārya lineage preserving and passing down the divine teachings of Śrīman Nārāyaṇa.

name: Itihāsas & Purāṇas
description: Scriptures that unveil dharma and devotion
longDescription: Comprising historical epics and lores, they convey eternal truths and philosophical principles.

name: Stotras
description: Devotional hymns glorifying Bhagavān and Ācāryas
longDescription: These hymns eulogize Bhagavān and the revered Ācāryas of the Śrī Vaiṣṇava Sampradāya.

name: Āgamas
description: Scriptures that guide rituals and temple worship
longDescription: These scriptures define temple design, iconography, and daily worship in the Śrī Vaiṣṇava Sampradāya.

name: Theology
description: A systematic exposition of divine truths leading to Mokṣa
longDescription: Śrī Vaiṣṇava theology elucidates the relationship between Śrīman Nārāyaṇa, the Jīvātmā, and the path to Mokṣa.

name: Vedas
description: The primordial scriptures of Sanātana Dharma
longDescription: The foundational and scriptural authorities upheld by the Śrī Vaiṣṇava Sampradāya.

name: Vedānta
description: The philosophical essence and culmination of the Vedas
longDescription: The philosophical essence of the Vedas, culminating in teachings on Brahman, the Jīvātmā, and Mokṣa.
